;五角大楼正在从亿万富翁埃隆马斯克的 SpaceX 购买 Starlink 卫星通信终端和服务供使用国防部表示，这些终端可能是乌克兰军方购买的。

;

;这些终端可能是根据乌克兰安全援助计划购买的，该计划旨在满足陷入困境的国家的长期安全需求。

;

;去年 12 月，美国国防部在宣布这样一项资助计划时透露，它将向乌克兰提供卫星通信“终端和服务”，但并未证实马斯克的公司会获得合同。

;

;“我们继续五角大楼周四在一份声明中表示，与一系列全球合作伙伴合作，确保乌克兰拥有他们所需的弹性卫星和通信能力。 “卫星通信构成了乌克兰整体通信网络的重要层，该部门与 Starlink 签订了此类服务合同。”

;

;“但是，出于操作安全原因和这些系统的关键性质，我们目前没有关于具体能力、合同或合作伙伴的额外信息，”它说。

;

;美国军方官员赞扬了自俄罗斯入侵以来便携式 Starlink 终端在乌克兰保持安全的作用。平民人口连接起来，并为该国军队提供重要的通信。

;

;该声明是五角大楼与马斯克在终端问题上经常有争议的关系的最新转折。据报道，去年 10 月的某个时候，马斯克告诉五角大楼，SpaceX 不会继续为便携式终端买单，只是为了扭转这一立场。

;

;同月，马斯克提出了一项和平提案，要求乌克兰保持中立，将克里米亚割让给俄罗斯，并在俄罗斯接管的乌克兰地区重新举行选举。

;

;埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 在推特上发布他的俄罗斯和平计划，激怒了乌克兰

;

;“这是高度很可能是最终的结果——只是在那之前有多少人死去的问题，”马斯克在他现在拥有的 Twitter 上写道。 “同样值得注意的是，尽管不太可能，这场冲突的结果可能是核战争。”

;

;乌克兰总统沃洛德米尔·泽伦斯基 (Volodymyr Zelensky) 的回应是邀请世界首富马斯克前往乌克兰，看看“俄罗斯做了什么这里”。泽伦斯基赞扬了 Starlink，称多亏了这些终端，“生命得以维持”。

;

;最近，马斯克批评乌克兰使用 Starlink 终端进行战斗，他在 2 月的一条推文中说：“Starlink 是通信乌克兰的骨干网，尤其是在前线，那里几乎所有其他互联网连接都已被摧毁。但我们不会让可能导致第三次世界大战的冲突升级。”

;

;SpaceX 商业终端，“和其他商业产品一样，是供私人使用，而不是军事用途，但我们没有行使转向的权利他们离开。我们正在努力做正确的事，而‘正确的事’是一个极其困难的道德问题”，他在推特上写道。在华盛顿举行的一次会议上，Starlink 被用于意想不到的方式，该公司此后一直试图阻止这种情况。

;

;“它从未打算被武器化，”她说。乌克兰人“以无意的方式利用它”，并超越了军方的通讯方式。她援引新闻报道称“他们正在无人机上使用我们的技术”。

;

;马斯克的 SpaceX 与五角大楼建立了牢固的联系，打破了曾经由两家最大的国防承包商垄断的局面，并赢得了发射合同美国最敏感的国家安全卫星。

;

;德桑蒂斯 2024 年的发射一开始就出了问题，特朗普准备挑衅

;

;但对于这位反复无常的企业家来说，与白宫的关系一直不稳定，他敦促美国人投票给共和党人，曾嘲笑总统乔拜登是人形的潮湿袜子木偶。

;

;上周，佛罗里达州共和党州长罗恩德桑蒂斯在 Twitter 上与马斯克一起发起了他的总统竞选活动。

;

;11 月，拜登表示马斯克与其他国家的关系“值得研究”，但他拒绝透露马斯克是否有任何不当行为。

;

;拜登政府去年讨论了美国是否应该据知情人士透露，让马斯克的一些企业接受国家安全审查。

;中国国防部长周四表示，北京“绝对不会”放弃使用武力将台湾与中国大陆统一起来，也不会容忍自治岛屿的民进党为台湾独立寻求其他国家的支持。

;

;国防部发言人谭克非向记者讲述了中国国防部长上将李尚福在当天早些时候的一次会议上告诉新加坡外长黄永宏。

;

;该部的声明是罕见的，因为它点名提到有独立倾向的民进党，同时重申北京反对排除使用的立场的力量。台湾正准备在 1 月份举行总统选举。

;

;国防部最后一次提到这两件事是在去年 12 月的一份声明中，当时是在回应五角大楼发布的中国军力年度报告时。

;

;参考资料民进党和使用武力通常来自北京国台办。

;

;中国、新加坡同意为“高层”军事会谈建立电话联系

;

;“我们将继续以最大的诚意和最大的努力争取和平统一，”谭周四表示。

;

;“但我们绝不会容忍民进党当局寻求外国支持台独的任何企图，也不会我们容忍任何外部势力利用台湾遏制中国的企图。我们绝对不会承诺放弃使用武力。”

;

;该声明反映了中国国家主席习近平在 10 月第 20 届共产党代表大会上的讲话，当时习近平开始了他的第三个党的领导人任期。

;

;习近平当时表示，中国大陆将继续以“最大诚意和最大努力”寻求和平统一，但“绝不承诺放弃使用武力”，“保留采取一切必要措施的选择” .

;

;第二任期接近尾声的台湾总统蔡英文再次被禁止参选。所以这次选举，民进党提名了副总统赖清德，他支持台湾是一个主权独立国家，不属于中华人民共和国的观点。

;

;大多数国家不承认台湾独立，接受北京作为中国的唯一政府。北京将这个自治岛屿视为一个分裂的中国省份，最终将被其控制。

;

;“台湾是中国的台湾，台湾问题是中国核心利益的核心，”谭说.

;

;北京远望军事科技智库研究员周晨鸣表示：“李克强此番言论不仅是为了警告华盛顿和台北不要推动‘台独运动’，也是提醒东南亚国家在处理台湾问题时不要被美国利用。”

;

;“美国一直希望东盟国家为台湾做点什么，或者与台湾站在一起遏制北京。因此，北京应该坚定地重申其立场。”

;

;李正率领由数十名高级军官和国防专家组成的中国代表团参加亚洲最大的国防会议香格里拉对话，该对话将于周五开始。< /p>;

;这是他第一次参加论坛，李克强将在周日谈论中国的新安全举措。

; Fri, 02 Jun 2023 00:50:02 +0800 LGBTQ Pride month kicks off with protests, parades, partieshttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/united-states-canada/article/3222658/lgbtq-pride-month-kicks-protests-parades-parties?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.01 23:52;
;;

;6 月初标志着美国和部分地区骄傲月的开始世界，一个庆祝 LGBTQ 社区的生活和经历并抗议最近对来之不易的民权成果的攻击的季节。

;

;今年的骄傲发生在有争议的政治气氛中，一些州立法者试图禁止变装秀，禁止性别肯定护理，并限制教师在课堂上谈论性和性别的方式。

;

;活动已被打乱。表演者受到骚扰。 11 月在科罗拉多州，一名枪手在一家同性恋夜总会内向他们开枪，造成 5 人死亡，数人受伤。

;

;“我们现在看到的可能是自早期以来最糟糕的情况，纽约市组织 Reclaim Pride Coalition 的联合创始人之一杰伊·沃克 (Jay W. Walker) 说。

;

;但这并不能阻止人们他说，本月不能出来庆祝骄傲。

;

;“你不能让我们的社区失望。没有人可以。这是基本人权，”沃克说。

;

;自 6 月 28 日纽约市首次骄傲游行（当时被称为“克里斯托弗街同性恋解放日”游行）以来，6 月一直是 LGBTQ 权利运动的重要月份，1970 年。

;

;该事件标志着前一年的反抗行为，即 1969 年在纽约市石墙旅馆发生的起义。在警察突击搜查同性恋酒吧后，部分由有色人种跨性别女性带领的人群发泄愤怒，与当局对峙。它是推动 LGBTQ 权利的全球运动的催化剂。

;

;菲律宾环球小姐在天主教徒占多数的国家以双性恋身份出现

;

;半个多世纪以来，每年一度的游行是要求就艾滋病流行和同性婚姻等具体问题采取行动的机会，同时也是一种公共庆祝活动。

;

;如今，全国各地都可以找到骄傲庆祝活动和活动.

;

;许多美国最大的城市——包括纽约、旧金山、芝加哥、丹佛和明尼阿波利斯——在 6 月的最后一个周末举行主要游行，而一些城市则在整个月甚至整个月举办活动在一年中的其他时间。

;

;除了游行，骄傲组织者在 6 月份还举办了从阅读和表演到聚会和街头节日的各种活动。

;

;本周末在佛罗里达州、奥兰多地区的主题公园和酒店将举办一年一度的同性恋日活动，即使在州长罗恩德桑蒂斯和州立法者通过了一系列反 LGBTQ 法律之后，这些活动仍在继续，其中一些法律禁止在课堂上讨论性取向。;

;骄傲活动也在全球范围内举行，在圣保罗、特拉维夫、马德里和多伦多等地吸引了大量人群。

;

;在过去的一些活动中，人们对商业主义和企业存在表示担忧这掩盖了仍未解决的实际问题。

;

;在过去的几年里，纽约市在更大范围的骄傲游行的同一天举行了第二次活动。 Reclaim Pride Coalition 表示，他们的活动让人想起激发石墙的抗议精神。

;

;在同性恋夜总会枪击事件中，有 5 人死亡，25 人受伤；枪手被捕

;

;纽约市堤防游行表明骄傲是关于抗议，而不仅仅是游行。

;

;近年来，骄傲游行有很多值得庆祝的事情，例如 2015 年，当美国最高法院在 Obergefell 诉 Hodges 案的裁决中承认同性婚姻时。

;

;但过去几年更加困难；骄傲活动在大流行期间受到限制，当他们去年重新回到现场时，鉴于仇恨言论和反 LGBTQ 立法行动的兴起，它带有一种紧迫感。

;

;全国各地，至少有 17 个州限制或禁止对未成年人提供性别肯定医疗服务，跨性别运动员在至少 20 个州的学校面临限制。

;

;“今年的情绪将以抵抗为中心，寻找力量和社区，以我们的快乐、我们存在的权利和我们在这里的权利为中心，”州立法主任兼人权运动组织高级顾问凯瑟琳·奥克利 (Cathryn Oakley) 说。

;

;奥克利说，LGBTQ 社区需要“致力于继续抵制那些试图阻止我们成为完整、快乐、快乐、繁荣的自我的力量。 ……团结起来，反击为我们而来的压迫性力量。”

; Fri, 02 Jun 2023 00:20:03 +0800 Pigs might fly but their fat shouldn’t, environmental experts warnhttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/europe/article/3222654/pigs-might-fly-their-fat-shouldnt-environmental-experts-warn?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.01 23:23;
;;

;欧洲的航空公司正在迅速占用可用动物脂肪的供应来生产生物燃料，创造根据一份新报告，包括棕榈油产量激增在内的意外生态连锁危害。

;

;从巴黎飞往纽约的航班完全由动物脂肪等废弃生物燃料提供动力，需要约 8,800 头死猪，根据委托进行这项研究的可持续交通倡导组织 Transport & Environment 的说法。

;

;这项由咨询公司 Cerulogy 进行的研究发现，欧盟的补贴意在鼓励在道路和空中使用提炼脂肪十年来，旅行对动物脂肪生物柴油的需求翻了一番。

;

;由于供应有限，这推高了肥皂、化妆品和宠物食品制造等领域提炼脂肪的其他用户的价格。棕榈油是最有可能的替代品——造成新的环境影响，因为在印度尼西亚等国家，广阔的种植园导致森林砍伐。

;

;随着生物燃料吸引力的增加，世界食用油短缺迫在眉睫

;

;“多年来，我们一直在司机不知情的情况下在汽车中燃烧动物脂肪”，T&E 的生物燃料专家 Barbara Smailagic 说。 “现在他们将为你的下一次飞行加油。但如果不剥夺其他部门的利益，这种情况就无法持续。

;

;该研究强调了清理航空业的难度，其二氧化碳排放量目前在全球范围内占 2-3%，有望未来几十年上升。欧盟政策制定者一直试图鼓励在喷气燃料生产中部分使用废弃脂肪，因为将其与化石燃料混合是在短期内减少该行业温室气体产生的少数方法之一。

;

;航空公司包括 Ryanair 和 Wizz Air 在内的供应商已与 Neste Oyj 等供应商达成供应合同，后者利用可再生废物和原材料（如使用过的食用油和动物脂肪）生产所谓的可持续航空燃料。

;

;Cerulogy 研究还发现有迹象表明，通常用于宠物食品、动物饲料和化妆品的最优质动物脂肪也越来越多地用于燃料库存。

;

;这些脂肪在历史上一直比较低质量的脂肪贵- 用于生物燃料的优质动物副产品。但根据 T&E 的说法，欧盟对较便宜成分的补贴改变了计算方式，产生了对优质脂肪贴错标签的经济诱因。

;

;

;

;

;

;

;尽管失业率创历史新高，但中国年轻人并不害怕发声

;

;但随着毕业季的到来方法，省级政府在解决学生面临的问题方面承受着更大的压力。

;

;5 月的数据将在 6 月中旬发布。

;

;

;

;北京已经吸引海外投资和吸引更多外国资本以提振经济的魅力攻势，但最近几个月它也通过调查外国咨询公司加强了国家安全审查。

;

;这并没有平息外国投资者担心长期削弱中国市场吸引力的政策不确定性。

;

;随着贸易禁令和关税的取消，中国在修复与澳大利亚的关系方面取得了快速进展，

;

; Thu, 01 Jun 2023 23:20:02 +0800 What message does China defence chief Li Shangfu have for Shangri-La Dialogue?https://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3222535/what-message-does-china-defence-chief-li-shangfu-have-shangri-la-dialogue?utm_source=rss_feed

;;

;国际日历上最重要的安全会议之一将于 20 日举行6 月 2 日在新加坡举行，国防部长、军事人员和政策观察员齐聚一堂。在 a 的第二部分，刘杰克探讨了李尚福将军可能会在他作为中国国防部长的第一个论坛上带来什么信息。

;

;在一年前的香格里拉对话安全论坛上，中国的魏凤和将军自豪地向来自其他国家的国防分析家、记者和官员保证，中国在从乌克兰战争到对军备竞赛的担忧等问题上支持和平。

;

;作为回应，当时提出了 11 个问题中国国防部长质疑他关于乌克兰、军事透明度和北京在南中国海的存在的叙述。

;

;多年来，中国一直在论坛上抵制其邻国和西方政府对人民解放军不服气的批评军队的意图，北京称其是和平的。

;

;随着军事设施出现在南中国海的人工岛上，以及其他军队报告与解放军飞机和船只发生不安全的近距离接触，怀疑只会增加。

;

;在 6 月 2 日至 4 日的香格里拉对话上，在两个拥有最强大军队的大国之间关系紧张之际，以新任国防部长李尚福将军为首的解放军官员将有另一个机会传达他们的信息在该地区——美国和中国。

;

;中国国防部长将在香格里拉对话会上发言来自中国的邻国——包括日本、韩国和新加坡——以及加拿大等西方国家。

;

;欧盟外交政策负责人何塞普·博雷尔和澳大利亚总理安东尼·艾博年也将出席会议。< /p>;

;去年8月时任美国众议院议长南希·佩洛西访问台湾后，华盛顿与北京之间的沟通渠道中断，尽管北京方面强烈反对，但至今仍未完全恢复。

;

;自随后，一些东南亚国家和美国盟友一直在与美国密切接触，在该地区举行一系列联合军事演习，北京认为这是进一步推进华盛顿对中国的遏制政策。

;

;印度尼西亚和美国有效去年升级了年度鹰航盾牌演习，包括澳大利亚、日本和新加坡在内的其他 12 个亚太国家参加。

;

;4 月，菲律宾同意让美国再使用四个基地，其中三个在台湾附近另一个在南中国海附近。日本和韩国也一直在建立更紧密的关系，华盛顿表示这将加强两国的外交和防务关系。

;

;分析人士预计，李克强将在论坛上发出强硬信息，并表明北京反对“美国霸权”的坚定立场”，但他的亲自出席也将为中国领导人提供难得的机会，与该地区其他势力进行面对面交流。

;

;“你参加的活动有点像西方主导的活动新加坡 S. Rajaratnam 国际研究学院研究员 Collin Koh 说。

;

;“所以，这就是为什么我确实认为他们面临的国内政治限制，这似乎是他们发表言论的首要原因。”

;

;共同抵制集团冲突，中国敦促新加坡和马来西亚

;

;最后在今年的论坛上，李克强的前任在一次讲话中表示，面对台独行动，北京的唯一选择是“不惜一切代价战斗到底”。魏还警告说，美中关系能够改善的唯一途径是华盛顿停止试图遏制中国。

;

;中国代表团在去年的会议上提出了类似的立场，当时中国人民解放军的赵小卓大校军事科学院表示，有“负面观点”认为香格里拉对话是由美国及其盟友主导并为其利益服务。

;

;新加坡国防部长黄永宏回应中国代表在去年的对话中有一个问题。

;

;“来到一个开放的平台，有时让自己接受一大堆问题，听听别人似乎普遍的看法，来解释你自己是否更好？还是退出那次订婚？这是中国必须自己决定的事情，”Ng 说。

;

;新加坡表示，美中安全峰会上的会谈给该地区带来“一些安慰”

;

;但在强有力的公开演讲背后是在论坛间隙举行的闭门双边和非正式多边会议，可以采用更和解的基调。

;

;可能不一定要表现得咄咄逼人。他们可以在该级别的讨论中参与更有保证或更不激进的部分，”Koh 说。

;

;自中国的 Covid-19 封锁结束以来，解放军也一直在与东南亚的同行接触，

;

;与东盟国家就南海行为准则进行的谈判在因疫情而停滞后于 3 月重启。今年到目前为止，解放军还与新加坡以及对北京友好的老挝和柬埔寨举行了联合军事演习。

;

;中国海军周三表示，将派遣一艘护卫舰和一艘驱逐舰前往6 月在印度尼西亚举行的科莫多多边海军演习。印度尼西亚海军在 12 月表示，它已邀请 47 个“友好国家”参加，其中包括朝鲜。

;

;尽管取得了进展，但南海准则充满了“不可逾越的”分歧

;

;但是中国不应指望老挝和柬埔寨在南海领土争端中获得支持——长期以来被视为东南亚国家联盟 10 个成员国中最亲密的朋友。

;

;访问高级研究员德鲁·汤普森 (Drew Thompson)新加坡李光耀公共政策学院研究员表示，无论是在香格里拉对话还是在行为准则谈判中，哪个国家都没有发挥核心作用。

;

;“中国没有处理与东南亚的关系……以妥协为目标，”汤普森说。

;

;“中国不一定希望在香格里拉对话中赢得民心，”汤普森说，他曾担任中国台湾地区主管，负责管理军方关系2011 年至 2018 年在美国国防部长办公室任职。

;

;“它希望阐明自己的底线，并指出如果其他国家未能适应中国及其目标，它们将面临的风险，”他

;

;北京与东盟成员国越南、菲律宾、马来西亚和文莱就南海的南沙群岛和西沙群岛群岛链提出主权主张。台北也对有争议的水道提出了声索。

;

;2 月，菲律宾抱怨一艘中国军舰向其海岸警卫队船只发射激光。

;

;5 月，河内向一艘中国海洋科考船和五艘护航舰发出警告。越南表示，这批船只已进入其专属经济区，而中国则回应称，该海域属于其管辖范围。

;

;南海：随着能源项目的扩张，爆发点的风险“很高”

;

;中国外交中的一条“红线”是台湾——北京认为台湾是一个分裂的省份，必须与大陆统一，必要时通过武力——预计它将在香格里拉对话中再次突出。

;

;一位美国高级国防官员报告说，在去年魏和美国国防部长劳埃德奥斯汀的首次面对面会谈中，台湾主导了双边会谈。

;

;大多数国家，包括美国在内，都不承认这个自治岛屿是一个独立国家。然而，华盛顿反对单方面改变现状。

;

;奥斯汀在去年的对话中警告说——就在魏发表上述言论的前一天——中国一直更具挑衅性和破坏性，几乎每天都有解放军在台湾附近飞行。

;

;李和奥斯汀是否会在今年的论坛上会面是悬而未决的重大问题之一，两位国防部长都出席了会议。美国周一表示，中国拒绝会面。一天后，北京表示华盛顿应“立即纠正其错误行为”并为对话创造条件。

;

;但香格里拉对话对中国的重要性已经降低，现在中国有更多的对话机会，新加坡尤索夫伊萨克研究所访问高级研究员马博说。

;

;“中国现在有各种国内和国际平台来宣传其安全政策，例如北京的香山论坛和博鳌南京大学国际关系学院副教授马说。

;

;中国于 2006 年创建了北京香山论坛，以回应香格里拉, 但它尚未获得更大的新加坡会议的牵引力和影响力。由与解放军军事科学院相关的组织者制定的议程往往回避有争议的问题。

;

;博鳌论坛获悉，美国在南海的军事存在可能引发冲突

;

;北京还表示了对其他几个安全论坛的支持，2 月份发布了一份关于中国全球安全倡议的概念文件，这是一种对全球和地区冲突采取的含糊但总体的方法。

;

;根据该倡议——宣布by Chinese President Xi Jinping last year – China plans to revitalise multilateral events such as the Middle East Security Forum and the China-Africa Peace and Security Forum.

;

;China has urged other countries to support the initiative, which it says reflects Chinese diplomatic principles, with the Iran-Saudi Arabian deal hailed as one of its successes.

;

;Ma said that China was still learning to find a louder voice in international discourse, especially in the English-language media dominated by the West.

;

;“It is natural for any country in history to draw global scrutiny once it reaches the status of a global power,” he said.

; Thu, 01 Jun 2023 22:20:02 +0800 European leaders close ranks against Russia at Moldova summithttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/russia-central-asia/article/3222644/zelensky-warns-doubts-about-ukraine-nato-membership-will-endanger-europe?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.01 20:59;
;;

;European leaders vowed to remain united in the face of Russia's aggression against Ukraine and Moldova on Thursday, staging a strategy summit on the continent's political frontline.

;

;As another deadly missile barrage hit Kyiv, and Moscow claimed to have repulsed a Ukrainian attempt to “invade” Russian soil, 45 leaders met in vulnerable Moldova.

;

;The venue for the European Political Community summit, the Castle Mimi wine estate in the east of the country, lies only 20 kilometres (12 miles) from the border with war-torn Ukraine, adding to the symbolism of the talks.

;

;Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky arrived first, making the short journey to his smaller neighbour while his own capital Kyiv counted the cost of another night of Russian strikes: three dead, including a child.

;

;President Maia Sandu welcomed the leaders one by one under a clear blue sky patrolled by Nato early warning aircraft, hoping to boost Moldova's stature as a small pro-Western democracy seeking European support and protection.

;

;“Ukrainians are fighting for freedom, European values and the future of our continent,” she said.

;

;And she dubbed the summit, “a clear expression of our unity, strength and determination to act together as a single family.”

;

;Zelensky, however, warned that the ongoing debate over how and how quickly to follow up on Ukraine's ambitions to join both the EU and Nato would embolden Russia.

;

;“We must remember that every doubt we show here in Europe is a trench that Russia will definitely try to occupy,” he said, calling for Europe to extend immediate security guarantees and “clear invitations” to Nato membership.

;

;Both Kyiv and Chisinau hope to start EU membership talks this year, despite Moscow's ongoing invasion of Ukraine and alleged attempts to undermine Moldova's sovereignty.

;

;The EPC summit was also being held less than 10 kilometres from the breakaway Moldovan region of Transnistria, which is occupied by Russian “peacekeepers”.

;

;It was held under tight security, with Nato's Awacs surveillance planes flying over neighbouring Romania extending cover over the tiny former Soviet republic's air space.

;

;The European Political Community groups 47 European countries from inside and outside the EU – and excludes Russia and Belarus.

;

;Only tiny San Marino and Turkey, whose newly-elected president Recep Tayyip Erdogan is preparing for his inauguration, failed to send a leader to the talks.

;

;Moldova leader unveils Russian 'plot' to topple government

;

;It is a forum for strategic debate and addressing regional crises and – for some members – a potential stepping stone to full EU and or Nato membership.

;

;“We must also think of a wider Europe,” France's President Emmanuel Macron, who first promoted the idea of forming the EPC, told reporters in Bratislava on the eve of the summit.

;

;“We must think of our Europe not simply from a security point of view within the framework of Nato and not simply within the framework of the European Union.”

;

;The Moldova summit also came as Nato ministers, including US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, met to discuss the agenda of the alliance's next summit.

;

;The Nato summit in Vilnius on July 11 will debate how formal a promise to give Kyiv on how and when to join the alliance, but in the interim Europe is keen to show support.

;

;Macron said the allies should find a way to offer “tangible and credible security guarantees to Ukraine” while the eventual questions of EU and Nato membership are pending.

;

;Estonia's Prime Minister Kaja Kallas went further.

;

;“In the long term, the only security guarantee that really works is to end the grey zones in Europe, which means that the only security guarantee really is Nato,” she said.

;

;During the summit, Macron and Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz will meet between Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev.

;

;Yerevan and Baku have fought for decades over the disputed territory of Nagorno Karabakh, but have both been invited to the EPC as Washington and Brussels push for a peace deal.

;

;Another long-standing European conflict, the stand-off between Serbia and Kosovo, will be on the agenda, with leaders from Pristina and Belgrade under pressure to dial down tensions.

;

;While the talks took place, fighting continued in Ukraine, and the governor of the Russian region of Belgorod said rockets fired across the border had wounded eight people.

;

;Moscow's defence ministry, meanwhile, said it had “thwarted” an attempted incursion into southwestern Russia by what it said was two Ukrainian motorised infantry companies reinforced with tanks.

; Thu, 01 Jun 2023 21:20:02 +0800 EV makers BYD, Li Auto set monthly sales records as price war in China’s car industry shows sings of abatinghttps://www.scmp.com/business/china-business/article/3222647/ev-makers-byd-li-auto-set-monthly-sales-records-price-war-chinas-car-industry-shows-sings-abating?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.01 21:07;
;;

;Two of China's top electric vehicle (EV) makers, BYD and Li Auto, set new monthly sales records in May, spurred by a recovery in consumer demand after a bruising, months-long price war in the ultra-competitive sector.

;

;Shenzhen-based BYD, the world's largest electric-car builder, delivered 240,220 pure electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles to customers last month, beating the previous record of 235,200 units it set in December, according to a filing to the Hong Kong stock exchange.

;

;That represents a 14.2 per cent increase over April and a year-on-year jump of 109 per cent.

;

;Li Auto, the mainland's leading premium EV maker, handed 28,277 units to domestic customers in May, setting a sales record for a second consecutive month.

;

;In April, the Beijing-based carmaker reported sales of 25,681 units, becoming the first homegrown maker of premium EVs to break though the 25,000 barrier.

;

;Both BYD and Li Auto stopped offering discounts on their cars last month, having been drawn into a price war sparked by Tesla last October.

;

;Many motorists who had been waiting on the sidelines in the expectation of further price cuts decided to swoop when they realised the party was coming to an end.

;

;“The sales figures added to evidence that the price war might come to an end very soon,” said Phate Zhang, founder of Shanghai-based electric-vehicle data provider CnEVpost. “Consumers are coming back to buy their long-coveted EVs after many carmakers stopped offering discounts.”

;

;Guangzhou-based Xpeng delivered 6,658 cars in May, up 8.2 per cent from a month earlier.

;

;Nio, headquartered in Shanghai, was the only major EV builder in China to post a month-on-month decline in May. Its sales dropped 5.7 per cent to 7,079 units.

;

;Li Auto, Xpeng and Nio are viewed as Tesla's main rivals in China. They all develop electric cars priced above 200,000 yuan (US$28,130).

;

;BYD, which dethroned Tesla as the world's biggest EV company by sales last year, mainly assembles models priced between 100,000 yuan and 200,000 yuan.

;

;Tesla, the runaway leader in China's premium EV segment, does not report monthly figures for deliveries within the country, though the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) provides an estimate.

;

;In April, the US carmaker's Gigafactory in Shanghai, delivered 75,842 Model 3 and Model Y vehicles, including exported units, down 14.2 per cent from the previous month, according to the CPCA. Of these, 39,956 units went to mainland Chinese customers.

;

;In mid-May, Citic Securities said in a research note that the price war in China's automotive industry was showing signs of abating, as carmakers refrained from offering further discounts to attract budget-conscious customers.

;

;Major carmakers – particularly those producing conventional petrol vehicles – stopped cutting their prices to compete against each other after they reported a jump in deliveries in the first week of May, the report said, adding that prices of some cars had rebounded in May.

;

;Tesla started the price war by offering huge discounts on its Shanghai-made Model 3s and Model Ys in late October, and then again in early January this year. The situation escalated in March and April with some companies slashing prices of their vehicles by as much as 40 per cent.

;

;The lower prices, however, did not drive up sales in China as the carmakers had hoped. Instead, budget-conscious motorists decided not to buy vehicles, expecting further price cuts to follow.

;

;Industry officials had forecast that the price war would not come to an end until the second half of this year, as weak consumer demand hobbled sales. Some companies that are facing low profit margins will have to stop offering discounts as early as July, said David Zhang, a visiting professor at Huanghe Science and Technology College.

;

;“Pent-up demand remains high,” he said. “Some customers who do need a new car made their purchase decisions recently.”

; Thu, 01 Jun 2023 21:20:02 +0800 Purchase platform says Hong Kong cinema has cancelled private documentary screening, after ‘advice to avoid public gatherings on June 4’https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/3222648/purchase-platform-says-hong-kong-cinema-has-cancelled-private-documentary-screening-after-advice?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.01 21:07;

;A popular Hong Kong group purchase platform has revealed that a private screening of a documentary booked for June 4 has been cancelled, saying industry representatives advised the cinema to avoid public gatherings on the day marking the anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown.

;

;Group purchasing platform AsOne said it regretted to tell everyone that the private screening of To be Continued, a documentary about an entertainment mogul, had been cancelled.

;

;“We have just received notice from Golden Scene Cinema that it has been advised by industry representatives to avoid gatherings on that sensitive day. And after careful consideration, it has decided to cancel the private screening,” it said on Facebook on Wednesday night.

;

;“It is a truly special day that even going to the movies is not possible.”

;

;Hong Kong security chief warns troublemakers ahead of June 4 anniversary

;

;The platform said it did not know if the event would be rescheduled. It would continue to communicate with the theatre and keep people posted.

;

;Dora Choi Toi-ling, co-director of To be Continued, expressed deep regret and disappointment that the documentary could not be screened at Golden Scene Cinema on June 4.

;

;“Since the film was released in April, weekends have been the most popular time for audiences to watch it. The two directors have only been able to attend and meet the audience on weekends. It has been the case for the past two months. And we look forward to continuing to interact with everyone in the future,” Choi told the Post.

;

;A spokeswoman for Golden Scene told the Post its focus was mainly on film distribution and promotion, not theatre operation. It added Golden Scene Cinema did not have a response regarding the issue.

;

;The Post has approached the Hong Kong Theatre Association and the major cinema chains in the city for comment.

;

;When asked if police had ordered private film screenings to be cancelled or whether any action would be taken against private gatherings on June 4, a force spokesman said: “In conducting any operation, police will act on the basis of actual circumstances and according to the law.

;

;“Police will make appropriate operational deployment in accordance with the threat to public safety, public order and national security.”

;

;A check by the Post on Golden Scene Cinema's Facebook account found comments associating the private screening with the city's now-discontinued annual vigil that commemorated the Tiananmen Square crackdown in Beijing on June 4, 1989.

;

;Some had posted their comments several days before news about the cancellation was announced.

;

;Hong Kong June 4 vigil likely to be on hold for fourth year amid park renovations

;

;“Finally, there is a place to commemorate June 4,” a Facebook user said on Tuesday. “It would be stunning to see everyone in the audience holding candles at the time.”

;

;“Bring flowers. Bring candles and other things you find memorable. Never forget,” another said on Wednesday at about 3pm.

;

;A candlelight vigil had been held in Victoria Park in Causeway Bay every June 4 for decades until 2020, when authorities refused to grant permission, citing the Covid-19 pandemic. Beijing imposed the national security law on Hong Kong in the same month that year.

;

;Permission was not granted for the vigil in 2021 for the same health reasons, while no organisation tried to hold the event in 2022. This year, 26 pro-Beijing federations will jointly host a carnival at the park from Saturday to Monday.

;

;Tenky Tin Kai-man, chairman of the Federation of Hong Kong Filmmakers, said the cancellation of the private screening was weird given the documentary was issued with a certificate for public exhibition of films by the Office for Film, Newspaper and Article Administration.

;

;“The documentary has got the certificate it needs for screening, I don't know why there is an issue right now. It's just weird. I don't understand why the date is sensitive for the screening. It only makes people imagine something different when the screening is halted,” Tin told the Post.

;

;“If it is true that the theatre was advised to make this decision, I really want to know why those industry representatives are making the call and who they are.”

;

;To be Continued starts with the story of the historic State Theatre in North Point facing demolition after a change in ownership a few years ago. Conservation groups intervened and uncovered the theatre's history. It goes on to explore theatre founder Harry Odell's contributions to Hong Kong's culture as an entertainment mogul.

;

;Film that's a love letter to Hong Kong and its 'first impresario', Harry Odell

;

;The documentary traces his voyage from his home in Cairo and highlights his entry into the entertainment industry in Hong Kong in middle age. Along the way, it follows various characters, including internationally renowned musicians who performed at the theatre.

;

;Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu earlier warned ahead of Sunday's anniversary of the crackdown that police would take measures against lawbreakers without specifying if individuals' acts of remembrance were illegal.

;Hong Kong has made its biggest green bond issuance, raising US$6 billion in a multicurrency deal as part of the government's push to establish the city as an international green financing hub.

;

;The offering included dollar bonds worth US$2.25 billion maturing in three, five and 10 years, €1.5 billion (US$1.6 billion) of four- and nine-year tranches and 15 billion yuan (US$2.2 billion) of two-, five- and 10-year notes.

;

;The sale topped the city's US$5.75 billion multicurrency green bond offering in January, which was the largest environmental, social and governance bond issuance in Asia at the time.

;

;The offering has been well received and attracted close to US$30 billion in orders from a wide spectrum of investors, according to a statement on Thursday evening by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, which acted as the government's representative in the offering.

;

;“The enthusiasm for Hong Kong green bonds from global investors shows their recognition of Hong Kong's efforts in green and sustainable development,” said Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po in a statement on Thursday.

;

;“The offering has included our first 10-year RMB green bond, which helps to extend the offshore RMB yield curve and continues to enrich offshore RMB product offerings, promoting RMB internationalisation in an orderly manner,” said Chan. “We will continue to regularly issue green bonds to promote innovation and further development of the market.”

;

;The green bonds are expected to be settled on June 7, and listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange as well as the London Stock Exchange, according to the HKMA.

;

;Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po said in his 2023 budget speech in February that the government planned to issue HK$15 billion (US$1.9 billion) of retail green bonds in the financial year that started April 1. The government raised HK$20 billion from the sale of such debt last year.

;

;Crédit Agricole CIB and HSBC acted as joint global coordinators, joint lead managers and joint bookrunners for all tranches of the offering.

;

;Green bonds are fixed-income securities designed to fund environment-friendly projects. Hong Kong plans to increase the use of wind, waste-to-energy and solar power to generate electricity in the coming years, as part of its push to reach carbon neutrality by 2050, according to its climate action plan unveiled in October 2021.

;

;The Hong Kong government has issued almost US$16 billion of green bonds since the inaugural deal in 2019, Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury Christopher Hui Ching-yu said at an industry conference last month.

;

;In February, Hong Kong issued HK$800 million worth of tokenised green notes, the first such sale by a government globally, paving the way for digital bond offerings in the city.

;

;On Tuesday, the HKMA also launched a discussion paper to gather feedback from stakeholders on developing a local “green taxonomy” framework for classifying economic activities considered environmentally friendly or sustainable.

;

;A green classification framework for adoption in the local market would “help underpin Hong Kong's instrumental role in bridging green financial flows between the mainland and the rest of the world, and hence strengthening Hong Kong's status as an international green finance hub,” according to the HKMA's discussion paper entitled Prototype of a Green Classification Framework for Hong Kong.
